Metadata: Uptake and internal distribution of exogenously supplied amino acids in the Pacific oyster, "Crassostrea gigas" (Thunberg)

Radiolabeled free amino acids (FAA) are taken up rapidly from dilute solution in seawater by soft-bodied marine invertebrates. The present paper reports rapid translocation and distribution of FAA to deeper tissues after uptake by the Pacific oyster, "Crassostrea gigas". A technique for inducing and sustaining steady rates of water transport through the mantle cavity of oysters is also reported.
